Text.Language: We have to be alert during our fasts and our prayers. We should not be negligent or postpone them from one time to another. We must persist in doing what we are required to do in meekness and humility as long as we are able, so that we would be considered obedient rather than sinful. The prayers and the fasting required were imposed by the disciples to remind us, at all times, of the pain and suffering of our Lord Who died on the cross to redeem us from the death of sin. He completed His sacrifice on Friday night as the evangelist said, â€œNow when evening had comeâ€? which means when Friday was over and Saturday eve had started. This indicates that the suffering of the Lord started on the eve of Friday and ended on the day of Friday and that is why the disciples imposed fasting and prayers on that day. We must honor that day with charity, mercy, and humility remembering what the Lord endured in terms of humiliation and suffering to save us.

At the third hour of the eve of Friday the Lord was arrested and tied. At midnight, He was presented to the Chief Priest of the Sanhedrin to be judged and beaten. On the first hour of Friday morning, He was presented before Pilate and his soldiers to be found guilty. On the third hour, He was sentenced to crucifixion and delivered to humiliation and beating. On the sixth hour, He was nailed to the cross. On the ninth hour, He gave up the spirit and was pierced. On the eleventh hour, He was buried in earth.
